intro: Mediocalcar uniflorum var. orientale, commonly known as the Eastern single-flower mediocalcar, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a short, sturdy stem and a single, showy flower that blooms in late summer. The plant's leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, adapted to its arid or semi-arid habitat. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, with a distinctive calyx that gives the plant its scientific name. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
